column4: i wish i read the "dont use breezy" before i started using it ;) lol
i want to move the cursor in the terminals. what is the name of that program?
You mean with a mouse?
gpm
yep
try telling that to lots of programs that REQUIRE a root password
the only way to configure driverloader is to have a root password since it is a web frontend and not an app you just run
there was a post in forums specifically telling you NOTE to upgrade this week
Should have read the forums! lol
well im not much of a forum reader ;)
i will just downgrade argh ;) bummer
lol ya ... why are you wanting to try breezy? to get newer software?
nope. isnt like that at all :) just another "time-waster"... i have too much bandwidth lol
lol
Ya. ... me too. Im installing kubuntu in a vmware session just to try it. Dont want to ruin my install by installing KDE ... EVEN if I can just use debfoster to clean it again
duh :P kde is cool, alltough a bit too cool for me.. it has too much functions to be functionable for me :P i need the less flashy interface
im total gnome user ^^
it is too messy. 10 million ways to do the same things ... and all 10 million things in places you would not expect them
yep... well thats life ;) about choices
I like xfce4 myself
xfce with nautilus is nice :) i need icons ;)
You should use vmware or qemm to try breezy in a virtual machine
